net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.licensor.interfaces.cli.spi

Class ConsoleInterfaceDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.licensor.interfaces.spi.AbstractPasswordPrompter
      • net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.licensor.interfaces.cli.spi.AbstractTextInterfaceDevice
        • net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.licensor.interfaces.cli.spi.ConsoleInterfaceDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Flushable, TextInterfaceDevice, OutputDevice, PasswordPrompter

    public class ConsoleInterfaceDevice
extends AbstractTextInterfaceDevice
    The default implementation of TextInterfaceDevice. This is the only implementation currently used by the LicenseManager in production environments, and wraps all of the methods in Console and the exit method in Runtime.

    Much of the documentation for the methods in this class was derived from the documentation for Console and Runtime because this implementation wraps the methods of those classes.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Nick Williams

        public ConsoleInterfaceDevice()

    • Method Detail

      • exit

        public void exit(int exitCode)
        Terminates the currently running application. The argument serves as a status code; by convention, a nonzero status code indicates abnormal termination.

        Note: Wraps Runtime.exit(int).
        Parameters:
        exitCode - The exit status to exit with

      • registerShutdownHook

        public void registerShutdownHook(Thread hook)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                 IllegalStateException,
                                 SecurityException
        Registers a new application shutdown hook. For the standard behavior, implemented by this implementation, see the documentation for Runtime.addShutdownHook(Thread).

        Note: Wraps Runtime.addShutdownHook(Thread).
        Parameters:
        hook - An initialized but unstarted Thread object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified hook has already been registered, or if it can be determined that the hook is already running or has already been run.
        IllegalStateException - if the application is already in the process of shutting down.
        SecurityException - if registering shutdown hooks is forbidden.

      • unregisterShutdownHook

        public boolean unregisterShutdownHook(Thread hook)
                               throws IllegalStateException,
                                      SecurityException
        De-registers a previously-registered application shutdown hook.

        Note: Wraps Runtime.removeShutdownHook(Thread).
        Parameters:
        hook - The hook to remove
        Returns:
        true if the specified hook had previously been registered and was successfully de-registered, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the virtual machine is already in the process of shutting down.
        SecurityException - if registering shutdown hooks is forbidden.

      • format

        public TextInterfaceDevice format(String format,
                         Object... arguments)
                           throws IllegalFormatException
        Writes a formatted string to this device's output stream using the specified format string and arguments.

        Note: Wraps Console.format(String, Object...).
        Parameters:
        format - A format string as described in #syntax
        arguments - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as defined by the Java Virtual Machine Specification. The behaviour on a null argument depends on the conversion.
        Returns:
        this device.
        Throws:
        IllegalFormatException - - if a format string contains an illegal syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other illegal conditions. For specification of all possible formatting errors, see the Details section of the formatter class specification.

      • printf

        public TextInterfaceDevice printf(String format,
                         Object... arguments)
                           throws IllegalFormatException,
                                  IOError
        A convenience method to write a formatted string to this device's output stream using the specified format string and arguments.

        An invocation of this method of the form device.printf(format, args) behaves in exactly the same way as the invocation of device.format(format, args).

        Note: Wraps Console.printf(String, Object...).
        Parameters:
        format - A format string as described in #syntax
        arguments - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as defined by the Java Virtual Machine Specification. The behaviour on a null argument depends on the conversion.
        Returns:
        this device.
        Throws:
        IllegalFormatException - if a format string contains an illegal syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other illegal conditions. For specification of all possible formatting errors, see the Details section of the formatter class specification.
        IOError - if an I/O error occurs.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flushes this device by writing any buffered output to the underlying stream.

        Note: Wraps Console.flush().

      • readLine

        public String readLine()
                throws IOError
        Reads a single line of text from the device.

        Note: Wraps Console.readLine().
        Returns:
        a string containing the line read from the interface device input, not including any line-termination characters, or null if an end of stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        IOError - if an I/O error occurs.

      • readLine

        public String readLine(String format,
              Object... arguments)
                throws IllegalFormatException,
                       IOError
        Provides a formatted prompt, then reads a single line of text from the device.

        Note: Wraps Console.readLine(String, Object...).
        Parameters:
        format - A format string as described in #syntax
        arguments - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as defined by the Java Virtual Machine Specification. The behaviour on a null argument depends on the conversion.
        Returns:
        a string containing the line read from the interface device input, not including any line-termination characters, or null if an end of stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        IllegalFormatException - if a format string contains an illegal syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other illegal conditions. For specification of all possible formatting errors, see the Details section of the formatter class specification.
        IOError - if an I/O error occurs.

      • readPassword

        public char[] readPassword()
                    throws IOError
        Reads a password or passphrase from the device with echoing disabled.

        Note: Wraps Console.readPassword().
        Returns:
        a character array containing the password or passphrase read from the device, not including any line-termination characters, or null if an end of stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        IOError - if an I/O error occurs.

      • readPassword

        public char[] readPassword(String format,
                  Object... arguments)
                    throws IllegalFormatException,
                           IOError
        Provides a formatted prompt, then reads a password or passphrase from the device with echoing disabled.

        Note: Wraps Console.readPassword(String, Object...).
        Parameters:
        format - A format string as described in #syntax
        arguments - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as defined by the Java Virtual Machine Specification. The behaviour on a null argument depends on the conversion.
        Returns:
        a character array containing the password or passphrase read from the device, not including any line-termination characters, or null if an end of stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        IllegalFormatException - if a format string contains an illegal syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other illegal conditions. For specification of all possible formatting errors, see the Details section of the formatter class specification.
        IOError - if an I/O error occurs.

      • getReader

        public Reader getReader()
        Retrieves the unique Reader object associated with this interface device. For more information regarding the uses of this method, see the documentation for Console.reader().

        Note: Wraps Console.reader().
        Returns:
        the reader associated with this interface.
